conjugations.exampleSentence: Io vengo a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu vieni a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui viene al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He comes to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi veniamo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi venite a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro vengono a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They come to the theater

tenses.description: Used to describe actions happening now, general truths, or habitual actions. This is the most commonly used tense in Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io venivo a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I was coming to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu venivi a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were coming home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui veniva al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He was coming to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi venivamo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We were coming for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi venivate a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You were coming shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro venivano a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They were coming to the theater

tenses.description: Used to describe ongoing, repeated, or habitual actions in the past. Also used for background information in storytelling.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io verrò a scuola domani
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will come to school tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu verrai a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui verrà al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi verremo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi verrete a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro verranno a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will come to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express future actions, predictions, or intentions. Often used with time expressions like 'domani' (tomorrow) or 'la settimana prossima' (next week).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sono venuto a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sei venuto a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui è venuto al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He has come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi siamo venuti a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We have come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi siete venuti a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You have come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sono venuti a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have come to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express completed actions in the past that have a connection to the present. This is the most common past tense in spoken Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io venni a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I came to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu venisti a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You came home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui venne al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He came to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi venimmo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We came for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi veniste a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You came shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro vennero a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They came to the theater

tenses.description: Used primarily in formal and literary Italian to narrate completed past events. Also used in southern Italy in spoken language.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io ero venuto a scuola prima che piovesse
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had come to school before it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu eri venuto a casa prima che arrivassi
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had come home before I arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui era venuto al cinema prima che partissimo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had come to the cinema before we left

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi eravamo venuti a passeggio prima che facesse buio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had come for a walk before it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi eravate venuti a fare la spesa prima della chiusura
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had come shopping before closing

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro erano venuti a teatro prima dello spettacolo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had come to the theater before the show

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another past action. Often used in storytelling to establish a sequence of past events.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fui venuto a scuola, piovve
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as I had come to school, it rained

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fosti venuto a casa, venni
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had come home, I came

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fu venuto al cinema, arrivammo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as he had come to the cinema, we arrived

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena fummo venuti a passeggio, fece buio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as we had come for a walk, it got dark

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena foste venuti a fare la spesa, il negozio chiuse
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as you had come shopping, the store closed

conjugations.exampleSentence: Appena furono venuti a teatro, lo spettacolo cominciò
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: As soon as they had come to the theater, the show began

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian to express an action that was completed immediately before another past action. Rarely used in modern Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarò venuto a scuola domani
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I will have come to school tomorrow

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu sarai venuto a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui sarà venuto al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He will have come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremo venuti a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We will have come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sarete venuti a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You will have come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro saranno venuti a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They will have come to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express actions that will be completed before another future action. Often used with time expressions like 'domani' (tomorrow).

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io verrei a scuola se avessi tempo
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would come to school if I had time

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu verresti a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui verrebbe al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He would come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi verremmo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi verreste a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro verrebbero a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would come to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical situations, polite requests, or actions that would happen under certain conditions. Often used with 'se' (if) clauses.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Io sarei venuto a scuola se avessi potuto
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I would have come to school if I could have

conjugations.exampleSentence: Tu saresti venuto a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Lui sarebbe venuto al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He would have come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Noi saremmo venuti a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We would have come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voi sareste venuti a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You would have come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Loro sarebbero venuti a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They would have come to the theater

tenses.description: Used to express hypothetical past actions or regrets about things that didn't happen. Often used with 'se' (if) clauses referring to the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che io venga a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio che tu venga a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che lui venga al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che noi veniamo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che voi veniate a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che loro vengano a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must come to the theater

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after certain expressions of opinion, doubt, emotion, or necessity. Often used after 'è necessario che', 'voglio che', etc.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che io venissi a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had to come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Volevo che tu venissi a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wanted you to come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che lui venisse al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had to come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che noi venissimo a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had to come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che voi veniste a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had to come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che loro venissero a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had to come to the theater

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian after the same triggers as present subjunctive, but referring to past events. Rarely used in modern spoken Italian.

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che io sia venuto a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must have come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio che tu sia venuto a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want you to have come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che lui sia venuto al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He must have come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che noi siamo venuti a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We must have come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che voi siate venuti a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You must have come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: È necessario che loro siano venuti a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They must have come to the theater

tenses.description: Used in dependent clauses after expressions of doubt, emotion, or necessity when referring to a completed action in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che io fossi venuto a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I had to have come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Volevo che tu fossi venuto a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I wanted you to have come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che lui fosse venuto al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He had to have come to the cinema

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che noi fossimo venuti a passeggio
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: We had to have come for a walk

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che voi foste venuti a fare la spesa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You had to have come shopping

conjugations.exampleSentence: Era necessario che loro fossero venuti a teatro
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They had to have come to the theater

tenses.description: Used in formal and literary Italian after the same triggers as other subjunctive tenses, but referring to actions completed before another past action.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Vieni a scuola!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Come to school!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Veniamo a passeggio!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Let's come for a walk!

conjugations.exampleSentence: Venite a fare la spesa!
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Come shopping!

tenses.description: Used to give commands, orders, or instructions. Only exists for the second person (tu, noi, voi). The subject pronoun is omitted.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Voglio venire a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I want to come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Devo venire a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I must come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Posso venire al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I can come to the cinema

tenses.description: The base form of the verb, used after modal verbs, prepositions, and in many other constructions.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo essere venuto a scuola, ho studiato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After having come to school, I studied

conjugations.exampleSentence: Prima di essere venuto a casa, ho lavorato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Before having come home, I worked

conjugations.exampleSentence: Dopo essere venuto al cinema, ho cenato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: After having come to the cinema, I had dinner

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another action. Often used after modal verbs in the past.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Una persona veniente
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: A coming person

conjugations.exampleSentence: Il treno veniente
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: The coming train

conjugations.exampleSentence: La macchina veniente
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: The coming car

tenses.description: Used as an adjective or in progressive constructions. In modern Italian, it's mainly used as an adjective.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sono venuto a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I have come to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: È venuta a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: She has come home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sono venuti al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: They have come to the cinema

tenses.description: Used to form compound tenses and as an adjective. Must agree in gender and number with the subject.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sto venendo a scuola
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: I am coming to school

conjugations.exampleSentence: Stai venendo a casa
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: You are coming home

conjugations.exampleSentence: Sta venendo al cinema
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: He is coming to the cinema

tenses.description: Used to express ongoing actions, often with 'stare' to form the present continuous tense.

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo venuto a scuola, ho studiato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having come to school, I studied

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo venuta a casa, ha riposato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having come home, she rested

conjugations.exampleSentence: Essendo venuti al cinema, hanno cenato
conjugations.exampleSentenceEn: Having come to the cinema, they had dinner

tenses.description: Used to express actions that were completed before another action. Rarely used in modern Italian.
